Articles.Content:
The altitude and general achievements of [my previous attempt](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125121-Spring-loaded-rocketry?p=2012252#post2012252) were very meager. The capsule hardly rose above the point where the catapult would reach.

Let's try something else. I call it Project X-Bow!

Two capsules for balance. Only one is kerbed.

![zWrfi4s.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/zWrfi4s.jpg)

The bow is drawn.

![DMONFZk.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DMONFZk.jpg)

Aaaand Lift-off!

![EG919yF.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/EG919yF.jpg)

Launch confirmed!

![rPcyzr5.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rPcyzr5.jpg)

Reaching apoaxis!

![w6C0bCL.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/w6C0bCL.jpg)

![AxlYxXu.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/AxlYxXu.jpg)

Beginning descent.

![dHZpHqj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/dHZpHqj.jpg)

And successful landing!

![4mKY04v.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4mKY04v.jpg)

Let's have a look at mission stats:

![BhaHGKe.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/BhaHGKe.jpg)

![rIorYU8.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rIorYU8.jpg)

A total of 219 meters upwards. Still a couple kilometers short of orbit but much better than the catapult!
You should try this with KAS winches. Compound bow, anyone?
Lol, you're crazy. I like it.

Very nice, I like where your heading with this!

(a long time ago I made a rocket assisted catapult......and many Kerbals died -

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/9KlZlXwQppQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
)

> 
> You should try this with KAS winches. Compound bow, anyone?

While a compound bow would be awesome, I think building the pulleys would be hard. But I guess you could fake the pulleys with KAS winches....

With a recurve bow they are made out of layers of wood, so could you try having layers of girders (with many struts of course) and see if you can get a stronger bow like that? I suspect that it will probably just snap, but it might work.
Through extensive research and experimentation we may finally be able to use space age technologies to create ancient weapons! Now all we need is a huge Sword...
